DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluates success rates of tracheal intubation (passing a breathing tube)for patients who may be more challenging to intubate while utilizing one of two devices that facilitate placement of the tube with video technology.
DOC.criteria: adult 18 years of age Mallampati classification scale score of 3 or 4 Neck circumference greater than 40cm for males, 38 cm for females mouth opening less than 3cm, but greater than 2cm children prisoners history of easy intubation (success on first attempt with direct laryngoscopy) known unstable cervical spine injury emergency surgery nasal intubation route planned awake technique
